gameManager

Class GameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameManager.GameManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DisplayObservor, RobotObserver

    public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements DisplayObservor, RobotObserver
    Class interacts with display manager and reports to Game master, This class mainly keep track of the turn of the player.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int currentUnitTurn
      an integer representation of the current Unit turn (maps from the Players in the list)
      private DisplayManager myDisplay
      a reference to the display manager
      private java.util.ArrayList<Player> myPlayers
      The list of players that are in the game (should either be 2, 3 or 6 large)
      static int NUM_UNITS_PER_PLAYER
      The number of Units per player
      private GameManagerObservor observer
      An observer that is used by the display manager so that we can update things in the game manager without the display manager knowing of its existance
      private TeamColour[] turnOrder
      An array of team colours that represents the turn order.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameManager

        public GameManager(int numberOfHumans,
                   int numberOfAIs,
                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tankScripts,
                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sniperScripts,
                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> scoutScripts,
                   GameBoard gameState,
                   GameManagerObservor observor)
        Parameters:
        numberOfHumans - Total number of human players, selected from menu
        numberOfAIs - Total number of AI players, selected from menu
        tankScripts - ArrayList of tankScripts from robot selection menu
        sniperScripts - ArrayList of sniperScripts from robot selection menu
        scoutScripts - ArrayList of scoutScripts from robot selection menu
        gameState - the state of the game that we are going to be functioning off of.
        observor - GameManagaerObserver which will be gameMaster

    • Method Detail

      • initializeUnits

        private void initializeUnits(GameBoard gameState)
        Gets every unit for each players then initializes the unit
        Parameters:
        gameState - the gameState that we are basing all construction off of

      • setCurrentUnitTurn

        private boolean setCurrentUnitTurn(Player currPlayer)
        Find the next Unit that should move for the Player currPlayer.
        Parameters:
        currPlayer - The current player.
        Returns:
        True if a Unit was found, False otherwise.

      • makeHumanTurn

        public void makeHumanTurn(int playerNumber)
        Find the next Unit to move for the current human player. If the current player has no units to move this turn, end their turn.
        Parameters:
        playerNumber - the number of the current player

      • makeCPUTurn

        public void makeCPUTurn(int playerNumber)
        Find the next Unit to move for the current CPU player. If the current player has no units to move this turn, end their turn.
        Parameters:
        playerNumber - the number of the current player

      • updateDisplay

        public void updateDisplay(GameBoard myGameState,
                          int currPlayerTurn,
                          boolean turnScreenOn)
        Update the display manager to the view of the current Player a method used to call the appropriate method in the display manager the appropriate method will be whatever currently needs to be updated.
        Parameters:
        myGameState - the gameState that we are going to update the display
        currPlayerTurn - update according to the player
        turnScreenOn, - is it between the turns

      • getUnits

        public java.util.ArrayList<Unit> getUnits(int currPlayer)
        Get a list of the current Player's Units.
        Parameters:
        currPlayer - The current player of this Game Manager
        Returns:
        an array of units for the currently active player.

      • shootTarget

        public void shootTarget(int currentPlayerTurn,
                        GameBoardHex clickedHex)
        Attempt to shoot the clickedHex with the current Player's current Robot. This will attempt will fail if there are no units on the targeted tile.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerTurn - The turn number of the current Player
        clickedHex - the tile we want to shoot

      • move

        public void move(int currentPlayerTurn,
                 GameBoardHex dest)
        Move the current Unit of the current player from that Unit's current position to the position 'dest'. This move attempt will fail if the destination tile is off the board, or the current units does not have any moves left.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerTurn - the player who is currently active
        dest - the hexagonal tile destination of the player

        Parameters:

      • sendMessage

        public boolean sendMessage(ForthString destType,
                           Value payLoad)
        Description copied from interface: RobotObserver
        Send a message consisting of of the Value 'payload' from the current Unit to the current Unit's teamate of type destType.
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in interface RobotObserver
        Parameters:
        destType - The type of the Unit this message is destined for.
        payLoad - The contents of the message.
        Returns:

      • sendMessageTo

        public boolean sendMessageTo(int currentPlayerTurn,
                             ForthString destType,
                             Value payLoad)
        Send a message consisting of the value 'payLoad' from the current Unit to the Unit on the current Unit's team of type destType.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerTurn - the current player's turn number.
        destType - The type of the Unit for which the message is destined.
        payLoad - The value of the message
        Returns:
        true if the message was sent successfully, false otherwise.
